column4: hello - is there a tweak to automatically activate the 'numbers lock' when booting?
you should be able to set that in the bios
let me look I think there is also a system setting... one sec
Bugger, I can see you can setting it in KDE, but I am not finding the numlock setting in gnome. hmmm. another reason I use KDE.,,, LOL
let me look a bit further
- I'm not racist - I am willing to switch :)
If only I knew how - some preference somewhere obviously
in KDE you can set it in kcontrol its under Peripherals > Keyboard
in KDE you can set it in kcontrol its under Peripherals > Keyboard ozfrog
in gnome you need to look under Settings > Keyboard
- soory - I meant choosing between gnome and KDE at boot
in gnome - there's nothing to choose from concerning the num lock in keyboard settings :(
as you login check the session menu and select KDE or Gnome rcrook
as you login check the session menu and select KDE or Gnome ozfrog
